stem: Which of the follwing is true regarding Pre-Eclampsia?
opt2: Rarely seen in patients with pre-existing diabetes
opt3: Headache and blurred vision are alarming symptoms
opt4: Usually progresses very fast to eclampsia
disc:
Pre-eclampsia is a multi-system disorder which is characterized by new-onset hypertension, proteinuria or features of end-organ damage after 20 weeks of pregnancy.

Nulliparity is a moderate risk factor for developing pre-eclampsia (PE). Type I or II diabetes is considered as a high risk factor. (USPSTF criteria). Only 2-3 patients with PE severe features, develop eclampsia when untreated.
